I have an EJB project that has the following MANIFEST.MF file:

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Class-Path: lib/log4j.jar

I move the JAR file 'log4j.jar' from the <EAR Project>\EARContent\lib\ directory to the <EAR Project>\EARContent\ directory via the Project Explorer view.  I then go back to the 'J2EE Modules Dependencies' preference page of my EJB project and I get an error dialog saying "The currently displayed page contains invalid values." and I am not allowed to fix it.  The only way to fix it is to manually edit the MANIFEST.MF file via a text editor.  Here is a stack trace of the problem:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Path for project must have only one segment.
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkspaceRoot.getProject(WorkspaceRoot.java:164)
	at org.eclipse.jem.util.emf.workbench.ProjectUtilities.getProject(ProjectUtilities.java:728)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.application.internal.operations.ClassPathSelection.initializeElements(ClassPathSelection.java:364)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.application.internal.operations.ClassPathSelection.<init>(ClassPathSelection.java:97)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.common.ClasspathModel.createClassPathSelection(ClasspathModel.java:254)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.common.ClasspathModel.initializeSelection(ClasspathModel.java:216)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.common.ClasspathModel.getClassPathSelection(ClasspathModel.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.ClasspathTableManager.initializeEJBClientDefaults(ClasspathTableManager.java:110)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.ClasspathTableManager.createRadioGroup(ClasspathTableManager.java:167)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.ClasspathTableManager.fillComposite(ClasspathTableManager.java:94)
...
Will this be fixed in WTP 2.0?
This will not be fixed for WTP 2.0.  We will investigate for WTP 2.0.1

When looking for the resolution to this problem please also consider scenarios where the Class-Path entries are invalid and the 'EAR Libraries' container is being built.  It seems that if there are any invalid entries (i.e. missing JAR files, etc) on the Class-Path of the MANIFEST.MF then the 'EAR Libraries' container does not get constructed during EAR import, leading to many compilation problems within the EAR modules.
